variant.name: ActiveTab
variant.summary: Tabs between 0 and 1 day since last usage.

variant.name: StaleTab
variant.summary: Tabs between 1 and 90 days since last usage.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.AddToCartButtonDetection
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes to decide if a focused element is an AddToCart button. This is recorded everytime an element is focused on an eligible website when the DOM-based heuristic is enabled.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.ExtractionElapsedTime
histogram.summary: Logged when cart content extraction is executed for ChromeCart. This histogram records the elapsed time within the JavaScript, so script parsing/compilation time is excluded. Commerce.Carts.ExtractionExecutionTime is measured in native, and is the end-to-end elapsed time.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.ExtractionExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Logged when cart content extraction is executed for ChromeCart. This histogram records the elapsed time between the start and the end of the extraction JavaScript request execution. This includes script parsing/compilation time and sleeping time.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.ExtractionLongestTaskTime
histogram.summary: Logged when cart content extraction is executed for ChromeCart. This histogram records the time span of the longest task blocking the main thread of the renderer process.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.ExtractionTimedOut
histogram.summary: Record whether the cart content extraction has timed out. Logged when cart content extraction is executed for ChromeCart.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.ExtractionTotalTasksTime
histogram.summary: Logged when cart content extraction is executed for ChromeCart. This histogram records the time spent on execution, excluding sleeping time.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.FormSubmitIsTransaction
histogram.summary: Records whether the form submission is a shopping transaction. This has 50% chance randomized. Logged when there's a form submission.

histogram.name: Commerce.Carts.XHRIsAddToCart
histogram.summary: Records whether the XHR is to add a product to a shopping cart. This has 50% chance randomized. Logged when there's an XHR about to be sent.

histogram.name: Commerce.Compare.CandidateClusterIdentified
histogram.summary: Records when we identify a candidate cluster for compare and the source of triggering.

histogram.name: Commerce.Compare.CandidateClusterSizeWhenShown
histogram.summary: Logs when the proactive entry point shows. Records the number of products in the candidate cluster that triggers the entry point.

histogram.name: Commerce.Compare.ProactiveBackoffDuration
histogram.summary: Logs when the proactive entry point is dismissed. Records the duration of the chip will be suppressed (in days).

histogram.name: Commerce.Compare.Table.ColumnCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of columns a user has in a comparison table at the time a new/updated table is requested from the backend.

histogram.name: Commerce.Compare.Table.ColumnModification
histogram.summary: Records the action taken to modify a column in a comparison table from the table UI.

histogram.name: Commerce.Compare.Table.LoadStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of a comparison table load.

histogram.name: Commerce.Compare.Table.PercentageValidProducts
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of URLs in a user's comparison table that map to valid products. This most commonly means the product has a cluster ID associated with it. This is recorded each time a new/updated table is requested from the backend.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.DiscountBubble.TypeOnShow
histogram.summary: Records the discount type (page level vs product level) when the discount bubble is opened.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.DiscountsBubble.TypeOnCopy
histogram.summary: Records the discount type (page level vs product level) on Discount bubble closing if user has copied the coupon code, so this records at most once per opened bubble.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.DiscountsBubbleCouponCodeIsCopied
histogram.summary: Records whether the coupon code shown in the Discounts bubble is copied. It's a one-to-one relationship between the Discounts bubble and the copied status. This is recorded during Discounts bubble closing.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.DiscountsBubbleIsAutoShown
histogram.summary: Records whether the Discounts bubble is shown automatically. This is recorded when the bubble is shown.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.DiscountsPageActionIconIsExpanded
histogram.summary: Records whether the Discounts page action icon is expanded. This is recorded when the commerce tab helper finished computing which page action icon to expand.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.DiscountsPageActionIconIsExpandedWhenClicked
histogram.summary: Records whether the Discounts page action icon has expanded when user clicks the icon.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of fetching discounts in the shopping service. Recorded for every requested url. This is used to evaluate the local discounts database. For example, we may not need the local database if it returns invalid info for most requested urls / almost never returns valid info.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.PageActionIcon.TypeOnClick
histogram.summary: Records the discount type (page level vs product level) when user clicks the discount page action icon.

histogram.name: Commerce.Discounts.PageActionIcon.TypeOnShown
histogram.summary: Records the discount type (page level vs product level) when the discount page action icon is shown.

histogram.name: Commerce.Heuristics.CartExtractionScriptSource
histogram.summary: Cart extraction script could come from local resources or component updater. This histogram is logged when we try to get the extraction script to record from which source we are getting the script. The action of getting script is triggered when users visit the cart page which would trigger extractions.

histogram.name: Commerce.Heuristics.CheckoutURLGeneralPatternSource
histogram.summary: Checkout URL pattern could come from Finch feature parameter or component updater. This histogram is logged when we try to get checkout URL pattern to record from which source we are getting the pattern. The action of getting checkout URL pattern is triggered on every eligible navigation to decide if users have visited the checkout page.

histogram.name: Commerce.Heuristics.MerchantNameSource
histogram.summary: Merchant name could come from local resources or component updater. This histogram is logged when we try to get merchant name data to record from which source we are getting the data. The action of getting merchant name is triggered every time when a new abadoned cart is detected by ChromeCart, so that we can look up merchant name for the abadoned cart merchant.

histogram.name: Commerce.Heuristics.PartnerMerchantPatternSource
histogram.summary: Partner merchant pattern heuristics could come from Finch feature parameter or component updater. This histogram is logged when we try to get partner merchant pattern to record from which source we are getting the pattern. The action of getting partner merchant pattern is triggered every time when we need to decide if an abandoned cart in ChromeCart is from a partner merchant, which could happen both with and without user actions.

histogram.name: Commerce.Heuristics.ProductIDExtractionPatternSource
histogram.summary: Product ID extraction pattern heuristics could come from Finch feature parameter or component updater. This histogram is logged when we try to get product ID extraction pattern to record from which source we are getting the pattern. The action of getting product ID extraction is triggered every time we try to load the cart extraction script for ChromeCart, which happens after the user navigates to a cart page or updates the cart page.

histogram.name: Commerce.Heuristics.SkipProductPatternSource
histogram.summary: Skip product pattern heuristics could come from Finch feature parameter or component updater. This histogram is logged when we try to get skip product pattern to record from which source we are getting the pattern. The action of getting skip product pattern is triggered every time when a new abadoned cart is detected by ChromeCart, so that we can check if products in abadoned cart need to be skipped.

histogram.name: Commerce.IconComputationTime
histogram.summary: Records the page action icon to expand computation time. This is the duration between finished navigation and received all commerce page action server responses. This histogram is emitted after all server responses are received and ready to compute which page action to expand.

histogram.name: Commerce.ParcelTracking.{ParcelRequestTypes}.RequestStatus
histogram.summary: Records the HTTP request status for various calls sent to the parcels server. This histogram is emitted when the sender failed to create the network request, or when the server response is received and parsed, right before calling back the requester.

histogram.name: Commerce.PDPNavigation.URLSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of a Product Detail Page URL in bytes. This metric is only recorded if Product Detail Page recording is allowed by the user and on primary main frame navigation.

histogram.name: Commerce.PDPNavigation.{FeatureName}.Eligible
histogram.summary: Records whether a navigation to a product details page (PDP) happened while the user was eligible for the "{FeatureName}" feature. "True" means the user was eligible when navigation to the PDP occurred, "false" means they weren't. This information will give us an idea of the opportunity size of reducing restrictions to enable the feature.

histogram.name: Commerce.PDPNavigation.{FeatureName}.IneligibilityReason
histogram.summary: Records the reasons that a user is not eligible for the "{FeatureName}" feature. This is recorded each time a user navigates to what is detected to be a PDP (product details page) and records each reason that the user is not eligible for the feature rather than just one.

histogram.name: Commerce.PDPStateOnNavigation
histogram.summary: Records whether a navigation is to a product details page and then whether the information we retrieved about the page contains a product cluster ID.

histogram.name: Commerce.PDPStateWithLocalMeta
histogram.summary: Records if and how a page has been determined to be a product details page after the page has finished loading. This histogram includes pages that are most likely product pages based on metadata extracted from the head section of the page (via local extraction). If the page navigates prior to the local extraction being executed, this metric is not recorded.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrop.AnnotationsEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether the price drop annotation is enabled. Recorded when user enters the grid tab switcher. The record frequency is controlled by a feature parameter and by default it is recorded at most once every day. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrop.NotificationChannelBlocked
histogram.summary: Records whether the price drop notification channel is blocked by users. Recorded when we initialize commerce subscriptions (For eligible users, we initialize subscriptions when Chrome becomes foreground app but at most once in a one-day moving window). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrop.NotificationChannelCreated
histogram.summary: Records whether the price drop notification channel is created. Recorded when we initialize commerce subscriptions (For eligible users, we initialize subscriptions when Chrome becomes foreground app but at most once in a one-day moving window). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrop.SystemNotificationEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether the system notification is enabled by users. Recorded when we initialize commerce subscriptions (For eligible users, we initialize subscriptions when Chrome becomes foreground app but at most once in a one-day moving window). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrops.{ManagementType}.NotificationCount
histogram.summary: The number of price drop notifications shown in the given time interval (one day by default) for the specified management type. Emitted for clients in our experiment when Chrome is foregrounded. Recorded at most once in a one-day moving window. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrops.{ManagementType}.NotificationReachedCap
histogram.summary: Records whether the number of shown notifications in given window (one day by default) has reached the cap limit for specified management type. Recorded when we are trying to show any price drop notifications. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrops.{TabUsageStatus}{LocationIdentifier}.ContainsPrice
histogram.summary: Records if a page contains a price, as determined by the commerce data obtained to power the price drop feature. This data is acquired when the user finishes navigating to a page. Recorded when the user {LocationIdentifier}. Recorded for {TabUsageStatus}.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrops.{TabUsageStatus}{LocationIdentifier}.ContainsPriceDrop
histogram.summary: Records if a page contains a decrease in price for an offer, relative to the previously seen price for the offer. This is determined by the commerce data obtained to power the price drop feature. The data is acquired when the user finishes navigating to a page. Recorded when the user {LocationIdentifier}. Recorded for {TabUsageStatus}.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceDrops.{TabUsageStatus}{LocationIdentifier}.IsProductDetailPage
histogram.summary: Records if a page is a product detail page, as determined by the commerce data obtained to power the price drop feature. This data is acquired when the user finishes navigating to a page. Recorded when the user {LocationIdentifier}. Recorded for {TabUsageStatus}.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceInsights.BuyingOptionsClicked
histogram.summary: Records the current price bucket of the product when the user clicks "Buying Options" in the price insights UI.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceInsights.OmniboxIconClicked
histogram.summary: Records the initial label of the price insights omnibox icon shown when the user clicks on it. If a label shows initially then collapses to an icon only, on user click, we still record the initial label.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceInsights.OmniboxIconShown
histogram.summary: Records the initial label of the price insights omnibox icon when it is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceInsights.PriceTracking.{Action}
histogram.summary: Records when user clicks the price tracking button to {Action} price for a product in the price insights bottom sheet. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceInsights.SidePanelOpenWithMultipleCatalogs
histogram.summary: Records whether the product that the price insights side panel was opened for has multiple catalogs.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.DanglingUserSubscriptionCountAtStartup
histogram.summary: Records the number of dangling subscriptions (user-tracked subscriptions without at least one corresponding bookmark) that a user has when the browser starts. This is recorded in the process of removing these subscriptions since the user has no way of interacting with them. This will only be recorded for clients where the subscriptions manager is created, namely, for enabled countries and localed.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.EmailNotificationsEnabled
histogram.summary: Records whether the user has price notification emails enabled. This count is recorded daily (once every 24 hours) or the next time the browser starts if more than 24 hours have passed since last recorded. If a user has not tracked a product "not responded" will be recorded instead to help differentiate users interacting with the feature. This metric is implemented for all platforms.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.IOS.{Source}.ProductStatus
histogram.summary: Records a product's new tracking state every time a user successfully tracks/untracks a product via the Track and Untrack buttons in commerce features on Chrome for iOS. This metric serves as a way to determine user engagement with price tracking relative to the iOS platform. This histogram was previously named Commerce.PriceTracking.IOS.ProductStatus.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.MagicStackPromo.OptInFlow
histogram.summary:
Records which opt in flow the user experiences when they enable price tracking notificaitons in the price tracking promotion in the magic stack upon tapping 'Allow price tracking notifications'. There are three flows: 1) User has never enabled notifications for the app before. 2) User has enabled notifications for the app but not price tracking. 3) User has turned off notifications for the app.
The price tracking promotion is for users who use price tracking on another platform (e.g. Desktop) but haven't discovered the feature on mobile yet.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.PriceInsightsSidePanel.{Action}
Commerce.PriceTracking.PriceTrackedProductCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of price tracked products for the user. This count is recorded daily (once every 24 hours) or the next time the browser starts if more than 24 hours have passed since last recorded. This metric is implemented for all platforms.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.SidePanelImageLoad
histogram.summary: Records every time we try to load an image in the price tracking side panel UI. This histogram logs 'Success' when loading was successful and 'Failure' when there was an error.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.Untrack.BookmarkFound
histogram.summary: Records whether a bookmark is found when untracking a site in price drop notifications upon receiving a price drop notification. It is expected that a bookmark should be present if a notification has been received. This metric is being recorded to confirm that assumption is valid.

histogram.name: Commerce.PriceTracking.Untrack.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether untracking price drops for a site was successful or not after selecting 'Untrack' from the long press menu upon receiving a price drop notification.

histogram.name: Commerce.ShoppingService.ProductInfo.FallbackDataContent
histogram.summary: Records whick type of fallback data (local extraction by on-page heuristics) was used when filling in gaps from Optimization Guide. This does not track whether the page was actually bookmarked, it only indicates what information might be missing or how often we get supplementary images when on a product page.

histogram.name: Commerce.ShoppingService.ProductInfo.FallbackDataUsed
histogram.summary: Records whether fallback data (local extraction by on-page heuristics) was used to supplement the data provided by Optimization Guide. This does not track whether the page was actually bookmarked.

histogram.name: Commerce.ShoppingService.ProductInfo.ImageAvailability
histogram.summary: Records the availability of a product image for an offer. The image can be provided by the server, provided locally, have both options available, or neither. The goal is to see the overlap between server knowledge and what can be provided locally. This histogram is available on any platform where the shopping service's product info API is enabled and is recorded only after the local, on-page fallback is run (since we need both server-provided and local to record the right value).

histogram.name: Commerce.Subscriptions.TabEligible
histogram.summary: Records whether a tab is eligible for commerce subscriptions. True when the tab has offer and the tab is stale (Last opened time between 1 and 90 days). Recorded when we initialize commerce subscriptions (For eligible users, we initialize subscriptions when Chrome becomes foreground app but at most once in a one-day moving window). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Commerce.Subscriptions.TrackResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a product tracking request in the subscriptions manager. Recorded when the request finishes.

histogram.name: Commerce.Subscriptions.UntrackResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a product untracking request in the subscriptions manager. Recorded when the request finishes.

histogram.name: Commerce.{FeatureName}.IconInteractionState
histogram.summary: Records the state the "{FeatureName}" page action icon was in and whether it was interacted with. This excludes cases where the icon was not shown, and is only recorded the first time the event happens for a page load.This will give us a clear picture of the effect that expanding the action to show the label has on click-through.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.CloseReason
histogram.summary:
Records the reason that the merchant trust bottom sheet is closed. Recorded when the bottom sheet is closed. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.DurationFullyOpened
histogram.summary:
Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust bottom sheet is left fully expanded. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.DurationHalfOpened
histogram.summary:
Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust bottom sheet is left half expanded. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.DurationPeeked
histogram.summary:
Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust bottom sheet is peeking. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.IsFullyViewed
histogram.summary:
Records whether the merchant trust bottom sheet is fully expanded. Recorded when the bottom sheet is closed. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.IsHalfViewed
histogram.summary:
Records whether the merchant trust bottom sheet is half expanded. Recorded when the bottom sheet is closed. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.BottomSheet.OpenSource
histogram.summary:
Records which ui the bottom sheet is opened from. Recorded when the bottom sheet is opened. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.ClearReason
histogram.summary:
Records why the prepared merchant trust message is cleared. Recorded when the prepared message is cleared. Implemented for Android. In M96 and later this includes MESSAGE_CONTEXT_NO_LONGER_VALID and SWITCH_TO_DIFFERENT_WEBCONTENTS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.DismissReason
histogram.summary:
Records the reason that the merchant trust message is dismissed. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.DurationPrepared
histogram.summary:
Records the duration in milliseconds from the merchant trust message being prepared to it being shown or cleared. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.Message.DurationShown
histogram.summary:
Records the duration in milliseconds that the merchant trust message is shown. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.MessageImpact.BrowsingTime
histogram.summary:
Records the user browsing time in milliseconds in a tab on the same host after a message shows. Recorded when user navigates to another host or the tab gets hid/closed. Recorded for all messages. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.MessageImpact.BrowsingTime.Rating{MessageStarRating}
histogram.summary:
Records the user browsing time in milliseconds in a tab on the same host after a message shows. Recorded when user navigates to another host or the tab gets hid/closed. Recorded for message with {MessageStarRating}. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.MessageImpact.NavigationCount
histogram.summary:
Records the user navigation count in a tab on the same host after a message shows. Recorded when user navigates to another host or the tab gets hid/closed. Recorded for all messages. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.MessageImpact.NavigationCount.Rating{MessageStarRating}
histogram.summary:
Records the user navigation count in a tab on the same host after a message shows. Recorded when user navigates to another host or the tab gets hid/closed. Recorded for message with {MessageStarRating}. Implemented for Android.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-04-25 to 2024-09-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: MerchantTrust.PageInfo.IsStoreInfoVisible
histogram.summary: Records whether the store info row is visible in page info. Recorded when the page info is opened. Implemented for Android.
